prs.title: solana: Add `set_threshold` ix
prs.truncated_body:
Currently there is no way to update the NTT manager `threshold` (# of transceivers that must attest to a transfer before it is accepted) - it defaults to 1 - or deregister a transceiver. With multi-transceiver support, having a way to manage transceivers and their threshold is essential.

This PR adds:
* `set_threshold` ix to update the threshold (`0 < threshold <= # of enabled transceivers`)

prs.title: Fix/send on closed ch engine
prs.truncated_body:
<!--- Does this work have a corresponding ticket?  Please link it here as well as one of:
    - the PR title
    - branch name
    - commit message
[LINK-777](https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/LINK-777)
--> 

The workflow engine encountered `panic: send on closed channel`.  This PR resolves the issue by holding the `stepUpdateManager`'s lock for the duration of the `send` call.

prs.title: op-supervisor: independent reset preparation
prs.truncated_body:
# What
Replaces older Reset Logic with new reset handling code

# Why
It was difficult to reason about previous reset code, and the event driven signals created resets on nodes which didn't need them

# How
## Managed Node
- Now contains a `resetTracker` object
- Any time a new Safe or Unsafe head is mentioned by the node, it is recorded and evaluated
- Any time this node causes a databa

prs.title: chore: fix bls pubkey format in bls_key.json
prs.truncated_body:
This PR has a simple but necessary change to prevent user confusion when migrating the BLS key from an older version of `priv_validator_key.json`, which contained both Comet and BLS keys.

Before this PR, the BLS public key was stored in `bls_key.json` in hexadecimal format. While this field was never actually used—since the BLS pubkey is derived from the private key rather than being read direc

prs.title: feat(price_pusher): add gas-price override option for EVM price pusher
prs.truncated_body:
# Add gas-price override option for EVM price pusher

## Summary
This PR adds an optional `gas-price` argument to the EVM price pusher that allows overriding the gas price received from the RPC via `await this.client.getGasPrice()`.

## Changes
- Added a new `gas-price` command line option to the EVM price pusher command
- Updated the `EvmPricePusher` constructor to accept the new parameter
- Modi

prs.title: Add serde support
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Optionally provide serialization with serde_with. Since the types already provide `Display` and `FromStr` we can use `serde_with` to provide `serde` support. 


### Why

This will allow storing strkeys in config files with their types and not just `String`.

### Known limitations

[TODO or N/A]

commits.message:
feat(serde): add serde_with support for serialization

Optionally provide serialization with serde_with. Since the types already provide `Display` and `FromStr` we can use `serde_with` to provide `serde` support. This will allow storing strkeys in config files with their types and not just `String`.
fix: clean up Cargo.lock to resolve merge conflicts

prs.title: Add fuzz test coverage Makefile target
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Add a Makefile target to generate coverage information for fuzz tests using LLVM coverage tools and output in LCOV format and as a summary on the command line.

### Why
Coverage information helps identify untested code paths by the fuzz tests and provides some signal as to how broad the fuzzer has identified branches. This library is a low level piece of code that warrants writing thoroug

commits.message: Add Makefile target for getting coverage info of fuzz tests

prs.title: go/roothash: Batch history reindex writes
prs.truncated_body:
Closes #6069 
# What 

During history reindex, we now batch `1000` writes at the same time.

# Why
As from the [benchmarks](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lq-Qe6jrrLUSKIkLLsIGOrfb31Ivi-hZKP0wAC50V1E/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.rg3qm3z5hci9), this already gives 2-3x performance gain for the single threaded program.

Given its simplicity and the fact, that it will be required by all possible

commits.message:
go/consensus/cometbft/roothash: Pass context explicitly

sc.ctx is the same as ctx received by DeliverEvent or
DeliverCommand, that triggers reindex or normal event
processing.

See go/consensus/cometbft/full package (full.go and
services.go file) to confirm.

go/runtime/history: Remove unused ConsensusCheckpoint method

This method was only used for testing, and is redundant since
Commit correctly updates LastConsensusHeight.

go/consensus/cometbft/roothash: Return 0 value on error

reindexBlocks is only called from processFinalizedEvents.
In case of an error, lastRound is ignored. To avoid confusion,
we always return 0 value in case of an error.
go/consensus/cometbft/roothash: Decouple reindex from event processing

go/runtime/history: Improve TestWatchBlocks

We add two more scenarios:
1. Local storage with notify set to false.
2. No local storage with notify set to false.

go/runtime/history: Add CommitBatch method

Commit is now only a special case of CommitBatch.

prs.title: feat: hot-reload burn_fee_cap in nakamoto
prs.truncated_body:
- Closes https://github.com/stacks-network/stacks-core/issues/5583

This introduces behavior to hot-reload the `burnchain.burn_fee_cap` config field, which is what determines the amount of sats sent to reward recipients. We previously had this behavior, but it wasn't implemented in the Nakamoto miner.

(I would not that the `satoshis_per_byte` config field _is_ hot-reloaded, still)

prs.title: tests: use rocksdb in the integration tests
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation

The next full node version will not support memory storage anymore and one of the nano contract indexes already doesn't support it. The main problem with using rocksdb is that the full node service takes more time to become healthy (with status port ready to receive requests), so the tx mining service and the test itself were breaking. 

Then I created a healthcheck to validate

prs.title: Fix a bit
prs.truncated_body:
1. balance_of_at needs to be able to query the balance at future block heights.
2. The deposit_markup logic needs to support large-precision tokens.

prs.title: fix: 🐛 add StorageVersion
prs.truncated_body: Add StorageVersion modification to feed-share and system-staking migration.

prs.title: introduce AccountEssentials trusted getter
prs.truncated_body:
for smooth UX we need to know asset balances with a single getter.

we should Deprecate AccountInfoAndSessionProxies instead. Yet, it comes handy to keep it for now. This way the breaking change can be gracefully rolled out as the new worker will be backwards compatible

prs.title: downgrade to XCMv4 and fix cli native xfer on AssetHub
prs.truncated_body:
closes #1701 
We tested asset shielding against stable2412 which has XCMv5
This downgrades the Location type to XCMv4

commits.message: fix AssetTip for native balance tranfer on AH

prs.title: Fix some docker CI issues
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes 

- Remove leakage by adding --rm to docker run invocations
- Remove resource sharing by adding a name to the docker compose invocations
- Add `-L` to all `nix build` in the CI 

### Issues 

fix #5011 
fix #5001

prs.title: Remove some remains of the deposit wallet
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes 

- Remove CLI options 
- Remove ui tests
- Remove support for application log messages

###

fix #4985

commits.message: Remove deposit wallet support for log messages

prs.title: Move to new e2e tests on macOS
prs.truncated_body:
- **Switch macOS to new Haskell e2e tests**
- **Rename concurrency group**

### Comments

With this PR, the ruby e2e tests are no longer run, and may be deleted in a future PR.

In my investigation in https://github.com/cardano-foundation/cardano-wallet/issues/4980#issuecomment-2684252738 I found no signs that deleting the ruby e2e tests now would lead to a particularly great loss of test c

commits.message: Switch macOS to new Haskell e2e tests
Fix mithril binary download url for `aarch64`
Use random wallet port in e2e tests

prs.title: [`Fix`] RpcStack in RpcClient
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Changed from type `String` to type of `JToken`. So it serializes the `JSON` correctly for method `InvokeFunction`. `RpcStack` was making everything a `string` and users only had the option to only make a value a `string`.

## Before
```json
{
    "type": "Boolean",
    "value": "false"
}
```

## After
```json
{
    "type": "Boolean",
    "value": false
}
```

Fix
